def: Having thickset tufts of parallel hairs, bristles, or branches.
An order of Rhizopoda, in which the pseudopodia are thick andirregular in form, as in the Amoeba.
Pertaining to allodium; freehold; free of rent or service; heldindependent of a lord paramount; -- opposed to feudal; as, allodiallands; allodial system. Blackstone.
The state of growing old; decay by time.
A drift; a tool for setting bolts home.
Preceding; introductory; precursory. "A deep precursive sound."Coleridge.
A variety of spinel, of a dark color, found at Candy, inCeylon.
The quality or state of being tetravalent; quadrivalence.
The outer, nonsensitive layer of the skin; cuticle; scarfskin.See Dermis.
One who kills, or attempts to kill, by surprise or secretassault; one who treacherously murders any one unprepared fordefense.
Shortening by apocope; the state of being apocopated.
